Generation I.Red: A Pok é mon that consists entirely of programming code. Capable of moving freely in cyberspace.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: A Pok é mon that consists entirely of programming code. Capable of moving freely in cyberspace.
Generation I.Yellow: The only Pok é mon people anticipate can fly into space. None has managed the feat yet, however.
Generation I.Stadium: A man-made Pokémon that consists entirely of programming code. It is capable of moving freely in cyberspace.

Generation II.Gold: It is a manmade Pok é mon . Since it doesn't breathe, people are eager to try it in any environment.
Generation II.Silver: A manmade Pok é mon that came about as a result of research. It is programmed with only basic motions.
Generation II.Crystal: An artificial Pok é mon created due to extensive research, it can perform only what is in its program.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It is a manmade Pok é mon . Since it doesn't breathe, people are eager to try it in any environment. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) A manmade Pok é mon that came about as a result of research. It is programmed with only basic motions. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Porygon is capable of reverting itself entirely back to program data and entering cyberspace. This Pok é mon is copy-protected so it cannot be duplicated by copying.
Generation III.Sapphire: Porygon is capable of reverting itself entirely back to program data and entering cyberspace. This Pok é mon is copy-protected so it cannot be duplicated by copying.
Generation III.Emerald: It is capable of reverting itself entirely back to program data in order to enter cyberspace. A Porygon is copy-protected so it cannot be duplicated.
Generation III.FireRed: Using the most advanced technologies, scientists finally succeeded in making the first artificial Pok é mon .
Generation III.LeafGreen: A Pok é mon that consists entirely of programming code. It is capable of moving freely in cyberspace.

Generation IV.Diamond: The world's first artificially created Pokémon. It can travel through electronic space.
Generation IV.Pearl: The world's first artificially created Pokémon. It can travel through electronic space.
Generation IV.Platinum: A man-made Pokémon created using advanced scientific means. It can move freely in cyberspace.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It is a manmade Pokémon. Since it doesn't breathe, people are eager to try it in any environment.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: A manmade Pokémon that came about as a result of research. It is programmed with only basic motions.

Generation V.White: A man-made Pokémon created using advanced scientific means. It can move freely in cyberspace.
Generation V.Black 2: A man-made Pokémon created using advanced scientific means. It can move freely in cyberspace.
Generation V.White 2: A man-made Pokémon created using advanced scientific means. It can move freely in cyberspace.

Generation VI.X: A man-made Pokémon that came about as a result of research. It is programmed with only basic motions.
Generation VI.Y: A Pokémon that consists entirely of programming code. It is capable of moving freely in cyberspace.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Porygon is capable of reverting itself entirely back to program data and entering cyberspace. This Pokémon is copy protected so it cannot be duplicated by copying.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Porygon is capable of reverting itself entirely back to program data and entering cyberspace. This Pokémon is copy protected so it cannot be duplicated by copying.

Generation VII.Sun: Roughly 20 years ago, it was artificially created, utilizing the latest technology of the time.
Generation VII.Moon: It can convert its body into digital data, which enables it to enter cyberspace.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: This Pokémon was created using the cutting-edge science of 20 years ago, so many parts of it have since become obsolete.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It was built 20 years ago by scientists who dreamed of exploring space. Their dreams have yet to come true.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: The only Pokémon that people anticipate can fly into space. None has managed the feat yet, however.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: The only Pokémon that people anticipate can fly into space. None has managed the feat yet, however.

Generation VIII.Sword: State-of-the-art technology was used to create Porygon. It was the first artificial Pokémon to be created via computer programming.
Generation VIII.Shield: In recent years, this species has been very helpful in cyberspace. These Pokémon will go around checking to make sure no suspicious data exists.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: The world's first artificially created Pokémon. It can travel through electronic space.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: The world's first artificially created Pokémon. It can travel through electronic space.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: It has no discernible heartbeat and does not seem to draw breath, and yet it appears to function without issue. I cannot even begin to explain this utterly bizarre anomaly.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It is an artificial Pokémon. Since it doesn’t breathe, people are excited by its potential to be useful in any environment.
Generation IX.Violet: Porygon is an artificial Pokémon created using advanced scientific means. It can move freely through cyberspace.
